Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Insomnia \In*som"ni*a\, n. [L., fr. insomnis sleepless; pref. in- not + somnus sleep.] Lack of sleep; inability to sleep, especially when chronic; wakefulness; sleeplessness. [1913 Webster]
insomnia n : an inability to sleep; chronic sleeplessness [ant: {hypersomnia}]
